desc: The HIST1H3I gene encodes H3.1, an H3 histone variant.

The HIST1H3I gene encodes the histone variant H3.1, which is a replication-dependent histone variant (PMID: 21481529,26527279, 25539924). Histone molecules allow for the effective packaging of DNA in the nucleus and are built out of nucleosomes assembled from histone proteins H2A, H2B, H3 and H4(PMID: 11498575). Histone variants, such as H3.1, have highly conserved sequences compared to the canonical histone protein differing by only a few amino acids. HIST1H3I K36M mutations have been identified in head and neck cancer; these alterations disrupt methylation/acetylation at that residue with implications for gene expression (PMID: 25484917).
articles/1/title: Analysis of the Histone H3.1 Interactome: A Suitable Chaperone for the Right Event.
